gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਰਿੱਗ ਬਾਚੈ ਮਹਾਂ ਅਰਥ ਬੇਦੰ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Rigg Baachai Mahaan Arth Bedan||
translation: Somewhere the Rig Veda was being read and somewhere the Atharva Veda;

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਸਿੱਛਾ ਕਹੂੰ ਬਿਸਨ ਭੇਦੰ ॥੨॥੨੭੩॥
translation: Somewhere there was the discourse about Brahm Sutras and somewhere there was discussion about the mysteries of Vishnu.2.273.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਅਸਟ ਦ੍ਵੈ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਕਥੈ ਕਥਾਨੰ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Ast Dvai Avtaar Kathai Kathaanan||
translation: Somewhere the discourse about the ten incarnations was being delivered.
There were persons adept in fourteen learinings.
There were three very learned Brahmins,
Who were unattached with the world and had faith only in One Lord.3.274.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਕੋਕ ਸਾਰੰ ਪੜੈ ਨੀਤ ਧਰਮੰ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Kok Saaran Padai Neet Dharamannd||
translation: Somewhere Koksar and somewhere Dharam-Niti was being read;

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਨਯਾੲਿ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਪੜੈ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਕਰਮੰ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Kok Saaran Padai Chhatra Karamannd||
translation: Somewhere the Nyaya Shastra and somewhere Kshatriya-Dharma was being studies;

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਬਿਦਿਅਾ ਪੜੈ ਬਯੋਮ ਬਾਨੀ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Brahm Bidiaa Padai Byom Baanee||
translation: Somewhere Theology and somewhere astronomy was being studied;

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਸਿੳੁ ਪਾਠਿ ਪਠਿਅੈ ਪਿੜਾਨੀ ॥੪॥੨੭੫॥
transliteration: Kahoon Prem Siu Paath(i) Pathiai Pidaanee||4||275||
translation: Somewhere the Eulogy of war-goddess was being sung with devotion.4.275.
Somewhere the Prakrit language and somewhere the Naga language was being studied;
Somewhere Sahaskriti and somewhere Sanskrit (or astrology) was being discussed;

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਸੰਗੀਤ ਮੈ ਗੀਤ ਗਾਵੈ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Saastra Saneet Mai Geet Gadvai||
translation: Somewhere songs were sung from Sangeet Shastra;
Somewhere the differences in the learnings of Yakshas and gandhavas were being elucidated.5.276.
